titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Commissioner of Deeds, Lyman E. Munson
CWG1766

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
To all whom these Presents shall come, Greeting:

Know Ye, That reposing especial trust and confidence in the integrity, diligence, and ability of Lyman E Munson, I do hereby appoint him COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS, Under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of said Commonwealth, entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes," approved January 7th, 1852, for the State of Kentucky, hereby investing him with full power and authority to execute and fulfill the duties of the said office according to law within the State of Connecticut. And to have and to hold the same, with all the rights and emoluments thereunto legally appertaining, for and during the term of four year from the date hereof.

SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FAL
In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 8th day of January, in the year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred and 634, and in the 72nd year of the Commonwealth.

Tho E Bramlette
BY THE GOVERNOR:
E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By James R. Page
Asst Sec
Commonwealth Office -- WM. E. HUGHES, State Printer.
Com of Deeds
Kentucky
Expires
January 8 -- 1868
As I am about leaving this state I hereby resign this commission
